commits.message:
keybindings: add emoji-picker inside given modes

Fixes #356

sourceview: disable emoji-picker by default

We'll add them back in our various keybinding modes.

terminal: fix block selection

This is handled by Vte, but we were supressing it even in the case when
we just wanted to activate the URI.

themes: tweak border radius for utilities buttons

3px is what Adwaita uses, so match that.

config-manager: remove unnecessary threading

This was both creating plugin objects on a thread and calling from a
thread. That's not okay for how we want plugins to be used and the
safety we want to provide.

theme: add a few overrides for elementary

There is plenty more that could be done, but these at least make a few
things usable.
workbench: hide fullscreen button on pantheon
theme: make styling more portable

buildui: show build panel when build starts

I'm still not sure if we want to do this unconditionally in the long term,
but this is probably fine for now.

My concern long term is that we might get into a situation where the user
had another panel of importance open and keeps getting ping-pong'd away
from it.

But until our panel system is a bit more complex, this is likely a fine
solution.
pipeline: add ide_build_pipeline_get_requested_phase()

editor: use DzlDockStack for utilities panel

This will help us fix a few issues including the initial selection as well
as fixing dynamic selection of children with dzl_dock_item_present().

meson-templates: use pattern-cli for empty project

We sort of could use a new pattern for "empty", but this is better than
using the same icon as we do for library.
make: add template priority
meson: add template priority
create-project: sort templates by priority
template: add priority to templates to sort
create-project: add helper to get template instance

make: add simple makefile template

This is a simple makefile with the targets necessary for basic integration
in Builder. We still can't debug these sort of projects (because we don't
have control of the inferior executed via "Run").
meson-templates: cleanup
langserv: use sorted iters for delete-range
plugins: handle G_TYPE_INVALID more gracefully

buffer: load symbol resolvers when plugins change

If the extension is updated in a delayed fashion, we still want to ensure
that the resolvers are loaded/unloaded as necessary. So separate the
load/unload from the signal we use to track loading has completed.

symbol-resolver: add unload vfunc

This allows us to be symmetrical, with load/unload.

flatpak: pass --command to build-finish

If we know the command from the manifest, we should pass that to the
flatpak build-finish command. Otherwise, we risk build-finish choosing the
first binary it finds in /app/bin.

Fixes #353
code-index: improve binary search assertions

config-manager: be more careful about already added configs

We can get into some weird positions with GTask and async completion, so
try harder to ensure we don't already have various configurations. Just
gracefully ignore them.
buildui: add note about empty build pipeline
debugger: use IdeTerminal for console log

style-scheme: fix line number background color for current line

This broke during various updates to the style scheme for 3.28.

buildui: bind pipeline GListModel to stages list box

Now that pipeline is a GListModel, we can simplify our list of connected
build stages. This also ensures that things are updated after the pipeline
is initialized. Otherwise, we would show an empty list in the case that
the pipeline was not immediately setup fully. Such can happen when
installing dependent runtimes.

buildpanel: track pipeline changes with signal group

This ensures that we connect/disconnect propertly rather than relying on
the finalization of dependent objects.

buildui: track changes to pipeline PTY

When the PTY changes, we need to connect it to the terminal. This fixes an
issue where the pipeline is not ready on startup so that the user wont
see the PTY at all, even when the runtime installation succeeds.

#354

buildmanager: call ensure_config_finish()

This pairs with the proper call. They should be the same, but that is not
going to be guaranteed.
buildmanager: improve cancellation tracking
pipeline: add mark_broken and remove get_pty to private api

pipeline: implement GListModel

It is convenient ot be able to track the pipeline stages using the
GListModel interface on the pipeline.

pipeline: disconnect ready tracking after setup

We can't really handle a single pipeline tracking load/unload/load, so
just disconnect our unload tracking after we have connected.

Instead, we rely on the build manager to reset the pipeline when the
configuration changes.
pipeline: cleanup docs

pipeline: don't pass cancellable to pty creation

Creating a PTY with a cancellable will fail due to lower levels complaining
about socket initialization with cancellables. This works around it by
ensuring we don't propagate the cancellable to vte_pty_new_sync().

pipeline: add IdeBuildPipeline:pty property

This is useful so that we can track when it changes and update the binding
in various UI components.
pipeline: add ability to mark a pipeline as failed

sourceview: cleanup ref_sink usage

No need to imply the sink to the transfer of the call, so hoist this out.

code-index: log file that contained no entries

Just to simplify the process of locating what indexers are at play.

vala-pack: add workaround for string arrays

Vala currently doesn't handle the null-terminated array of strings
being passed down correctly (const gchar * const *). This is a workaround
for it temporarily.
vala-pack: hold lock while indexing file
vala-pack: push/pop context
code-index: ensure dir_index is initliazed to 0
clang: SingleFileParse was 0,43

clang: hide some flags behind 0.35 check

Not sure the exact version for these, but lets start with this.

code-index: avoid off main thread usage

We wanted to remove the use of indexers called from threads and
instead keep the communication between objects on the main
thread (and let indexers do their own off-thread work if they
so decide).
code-index: add some counters

code-index: track source and index directory

This isn't being used yet, but will allow us in the future to
potentially drop the full paths used in the index files and
instead use basenames for a healthy file size slimming.
code-index: remove dead code
code-index: reference build data when storing to queue

persistent-map: fix incorrect assertions

We can change these a bit now that we know how they're getting
used in the new version of the code.
clang: code style cleanup
clang: always use dup'd memory for cursors

code-index: require new get_file helper for entries

This is convenient for the code indexer, so lets require it of
the code entries to save us some pain.

build-system: add helper to fetch flags for a whole directory

This simplies the process of getting all the children in a directory and
the build flags for each file. It will not return ignored files as those
ignored by the VCS.

glib: add helper to get children in directory

This is a convenience function to simplify the number of async callbacks
necessary to work through the data set.
threading: be defensive and clear structures

code-index: stub out new implementation of index builder

We need to rewrite this to avoid using threads. This just stubs out the
same API for where we will start with.
gjs-symbols: port to new code index async API
vala-pack: port to new code indexer API changes
code-index: fix G-I for index_file_async

clang: port clang indexer to new async API

This removes the "threaded" usage of IdeCodeIndexer and moves to
our new async/finish API.

It also creates a new CXIndex for each file, so we can more
reliably release memory after each parse. It probably means we
have to index some data more, but since this is a background
operation, I'd prefer to keep the memory usage lower at any
given time.
clang: add g_auto() helpers

code-index: make code indexer iface use async/finish ops

We don't want "threaded plugin API". Instead, we want objects that live in
the main thread, and have async/finish API (for which plugins can choose to
use threads if they like).

code-index: cleanup mutex usage and improve thread safety

There is still plenty more to do, but this is a good check-in point
before fixing up things more.
code-index: better mutex naming
code-index: code style cleanup and improve lock usage
code-index: code style cleanup and more assertions
code-index: more assertions and cleanup
code-index: code style cleanup for persistent map
code-index: code style cleanup for map builder
code-index: code style cleanup

code-index: remove context from search result

This isn't needed, so just remove it.
code-index: code style cleanup
code-index: whitespace cleanup

plugins: add more assertions to extension adapter

This adds more checks to ensure that plugins aren't using the engine
from threads. This cause some issues in the code-index that need to be
fixed.

langserv: set rootUri parameter

Recent language servers added a URI variant for this, deprecating the
rootPath path.

plugins: add some more defensiveness in extension-set-adapter

This tries a bit harder to ensure we have valid state going forward.

plugins: add main thread checks

Ensure we don't have things accessing this from other threads, since it is
not safe to do so.

context: use G_TYPE_CHECK_INSTANCE_TYPE()

This is a a better type instance check since we use the actual value from
the hash table.

cmake: allow specifying CMAKE environment variable

This allows the user to specify CMAKE=/path/to/cmake in case they need to
use an alternate cmake than the default cmake in $PATH.
meson: fix build system type check when loading tests
meson-templates: update link to gtk-sharp repo

make: add support for "make run" when running project

This uses a fairly common convention to use a "run" target in the Makefile
to run the project. We still require that there is an install target
because the run manager requires that the project is installed before it
can be run.
diagnostics: lower message severity
meson-templates: add Gtk♯ template
meson-templates: code style cleanup

flatpak: allow overriding PATH

We want to allow PATH to be overridden so that new PATH parts
can be appended. Such is used by SDK extensions.

flatpak: propagate builddir:(true|false) to config

If the builddir attribute is set, we need to propagate it to the
build configuration so the build system can potentially override
the build directory that will be used.
configuration: add helper to apply PATH to launcher
config: whitespace cleanup

pipeline: simplify cancellation chaining

We don't need a local cancellable.
pipeline: take path modifications into account

pipeline: allow removing _build directories

Special case, would be nice if this was abstracted but for now
we can just use the _build as convention.

subprocess: add helper to append to $PATH

This is useful in situations where we need to getenv, append,
setenv.

launcher: use NULL to specify g_environ_unsetenv()

This is useful to clear existing values.

meson: use _build if build locality is in-tree

If the build configuration requires that the build is in tree,
then use _build inside the source directory.

This can be needed sometimes, such as some meson scripts in the
wild that integrate with Cargo.

configuration: add IdeBuildLocality

This allows the build configuration to specify if it needs to
have in or out of tree builds. Flatpak can use this to propagate
the value of "builddir".
flatpak: parse append-path from build-options

configuration: add IdeConfiguration:append-path

This is useful so that we can plumb support for modifying
$PATH when executing commands.

flatpak: install sdk-extensions when bootstrapping

Instead of installing just a specific runtime, we want to
install the runtime, sdk, and any sdk-extension specified in the
GbpFlatpakConfiguration (manifest).

Related #345

flatpak: be more flexible with NULL branch ids

This allows us to avoid setting NULL => master which is needed
to match SDK-extensions which don't necessarily have a version
identifier specified.

build-manager: use ensure_config_async()

This uses the new API to ensure the runtimes for a given
configuration. This is more robust because it allows runtime
providers to install things like sdk-extensions.

runtimes: add bootstrap config helper

This allows systems to ensure all the basic dependencies are
installed before using a runtime. A flatpak runtime provider
would use this to ensure that sdk-extensions are installed.

Related #345
runtime: whitespace cleanup

flatpak: extract sdk-extensions from manifest

This is needed so that we can install dependencies beyond that
of the runtime/sdk.

Related #345

transfer: be more tolerant of NULL branches

This allows trying to locate any match when branch is NULL.
flatpak: whitespace cleanup
flatpak: add util to split flatpak ids

editor: fix tabs/spaces button actions

Now that libdazzle has support for enums via DzlPropertyGroup,
we can set the enum nick for the value we care about. It is
much easier for GtkToggleButton to deal with non-boolean values
for button state.

Fixes #334
po: ignore submodules to quiet damned lies on branches

terminal: add new-terminal-in-dir action

This allows opening a terminal in the same directory as a
given file. Right click on the file and select
"New terminal in directory".

Fixes #57
menus: whitespace cleanup

i18n: ignore test data from gstyle

These files should not have been configured for translation.

Fixes #190

gsettings: tweak summary to be more descriptive

Fixes #191

prefs: add gsetting for insert-trailing-newline

This allows setting the value without having to use an
.editorconfig file.

Fixes #210

meson-templates: add gtkmm application template

This does the same sort of HelloWorld gtk application using
C++ and gtkmm.

Fixes #245

omni-gutter: fix signedness issues

We need to make sure we don't promote integer into unsigned math, or we
will get vastly out of area coordinates.

Improves #255

omni-gutter: scale diagnostic icons with text

This has a basic implementation to track the size of the scaled
icon text in the editor. The diagnostic surfaces are reloaded
to be somewhat close to that text scale (following rather common
icon sizing).

Fixes #255

terminal: note when application exits

Give the user some sort of output that the application exited. We might
still want to add the ability to know how or why it exited (signal or
exit status), but this gives us something for now.

Fixes #260
terminal: add helper to write content to terminal

vala-pack: avoid copying unsaved files from threads

We want to access these from the main thread to get a snapshot of the
modified buffers.

file: don't cache files without contexts

We don't want to cache IdeFile unless they have a context set. Otherwise
we end up giving out IdeFile without a context, which is non-ideal.

rustup: avoid modifying preferences after unloading

This should probably be refactored before long to properly use cancellables
across the async function boundary. But for now, just track once we've
unloaded and avoid doing work in those conditions.

This fixes a gtk_widget_destroy() warning after unloading.

recent: notify has-selection when row selection property changes

This fixes an issue where clicking on the checkbox of the greeter's
recent section would not update the remove button stage.

Fixes #348
greeter: remove unused field

gettext: ensure lang_id is initialized

And don't pass NULL to the string formatter.

langserv: fix ownership transfer to call_async

These don't need to transfer ownership as call_async() onl takes floating
references and these are full references.
langserv: only log if not cancelled
langserv: use dispose to cleanup highlighter

langserv: fix ownership transfer to call_async

These do not need to have ownership transfered. The cancellable is kept
alive by the signal connection, and the params is not a floating reference
so therefore has no transfer what-so-ever.

langserv: use queue to push_tail completion results

We want to keep the order of completion items, so push to the tail of the
queue when building the result set.

langserv: don't submit results if op was cancelled

If the operation was cancelled, then the context is not expecting us to
submit our results. Short cirtcuit immediately when we detect this.

langserv: fix ownership transer of RPC params

These should not have their ownership transfered, as the caller does not
need to take ownership of anything except floating references, and we
do not get floating references from JSONRPC_MESSAGE_NEW() functions.

gettext: rewrite xgettext diagnostic provider

This simplifies the gettext provider as we don't need to use the task
cache, or any indirect diagnostics helper objects. We can just shove
the contents into stdin of xgettext and process the reply asynchronously
using the line reader.
code-index: readability improvements
clang: fix property type flags

clang: don't leak decl_cursors

I don't think we're hitting this, but in case we do, make sure the items
are also freed.
clang: use autoptr for diagnostic
xml-pack: use ide_file_new()

ctags: use ide_file_new()

In hopes we can share some IdeFile instances from the cache.

clang: handle ranges with NULL paths

We might get the end of a range that has a NULL path, so we just use the
path we got from the first location.
clang: plug leak of filename when indexing
clang: use g_auto(CXString) when appropriate
clang: plug leak in lazy init of completion item
clang: remove use of IdeProject from diagnostics
clang: use ide_file_new()
clang: don't leak CXString
clang: use ide_file_new
clang: cleanup string usage

project: remove IdeProjectFile and IdeProjectFiles

This wasn't really being used and certainly wont be long-term. Lets drop
it now. This ports the few places that used that code to using the
ide_file_new_for_path() which can do caching and proper relative path
resolution without the IdeProjectFiles unpurgeable cache.

file: improve fallback path creation

This ensures we get the same path when the file is in the project, as
other code paths would use to create the relative path.

file: use ide_file_new instead of g_object_new

This gives us the opportunity to use a cached file instance instead of
always creating a new one.

files: add a files cache for IdeFile

This tries to reduce the number of IdeFile we will create by caching
them. When creating a new file with new funcs (some code will need to be
ported to use this), we lock the cache and try to return a previous entry.

Another thing I'd like to cleanup (well other than possibly removing
IdeFile altogether), is to drop the file-settings after some period of
innactivity. We might event to only support loading them, and not keep
a copy for future use.
clang: plug GFile/IdeFile leak

sourceview: clear cursors before changing case

We don't want to affect the non-selection cursors. We can't support
multiple selections properly today, but we can at least keep the operation
working in the presence of multiple cursors.

Fixes #278

omni-gutter: take font scale into account

Update our font information once we get a scaled font. Fixes an issue once
the user has changed the font scale with ctrl -/+/0.

Fixes #293

source-view: add helper to get scaled font

We might need to take into account the font scale. This adds a helper
function with modifies the font-desc to take the scale into account.

language: fix license expansion for templates

We need an extra escape for lines ending in }} because template-glib
will swallow them.

Fixes #323

greeter: re-open previous project if we detect one

The prefix checks are sort of shaky, but we don't really support that
level of complexity in projects anyway. And we need to ensure we don't
open projects with different build systems at the same time.
config: cleanup configuration lookups
configuration: keep ownership transfer where it is used
greeter: more assertions

xml-pack: make population callback more robust

 - Fix leak of error
 - Ensure we always add_proposals(), even when that is an empty list
 - Various style cleanup
xml-pack: use guint for iteration state
xml-pack: don't leak GError
xml-pack: track ownership of completion context

xml-pack: various correctness and leak fixes

This fixes various reference leaks and correctness issues that could load
to crashes under some scenarios. Much of the async task ownership has been
changed to use the paterns we use else where in Builder.
xml-pack: use constructed instead of init to access context
xml-pack: ref counts should be volatile
xml-pack: code style cleanup
xml-pack: clear struct fields when freeing
xml-pack: don't leak TreeBuilderState structure
xml-pack: fix typo
xml-pack: whitespace cleanup

xml-pack: various code style cleanup

 - use g_print() which has more portable %s protections
 - always use guint when iterating against array->len
 - move some declarations into blocks
 - use const when array element is not mutated
diagnostics: ignore cancelled and not-supported errors

highlighter: be safer with usage of borrowed reference

Instead of stashing a pointer, unchecked, use GWeakRef to protect our
borrowed instance.
flatpak: don't cleanup flatpak binary

flatpak: bundle flatpak-builder in our flatpak

This allows us to stay more up-to-date with flatpak-builder, since it knows
how to execute commands on the host using HostCommand.

It also means we don't have to check for flatpak-builder on the host when
bundled in flatpak. So that is one less thing to go wrong on install.

There are a few tricks going on with the environment variables to make sure
that the flatpak commands running on the host find the right installation.
subprocess: code style fixups

subprocess: check for cancelled after connecting

We need to ensure that we don't race here (while it's unlikely). So we
can just hit the force exit path if we detect a cancellation after we
have subscribed.
greeter: fix G-I warnings
greeter: install greeter header

Merge branch 'update-flatpak-url' into 'master'

flatpak-manifest: update builder url

See merge request GNOME/gnome-builder!1

flatpak: remove extra-sources usage

This was unnecessary as it was just a plain-ol-bug in flatpak-builder. That
is being fixed upstream, so we should be fine.

We'll look into bundling flatpak-builder so that we can get things out to
users without them having to update.

code-index: delay builds until CONFIGURE is reached

We don't want to spam the system with build requests if we have not yet
advanced the build pipeline far enough. This can happen when the build
system is failed and cannot get past configure.

https://bugzilla.gnome.org/show_bug.cgi?id=791293

pipeline: add helper to check if configured

There are times we want to know that the project has been configured. This
simplifies that case instead of always requiring that the pipeline be
advanced.
code-index: cleanup cancellable usage
pipeline: chain cancellable without creating secondary

autotools: check for AC_INIT() in configure

If we come across a file that looks like it might be autotools, first
check to see if it has AC_INIT() defined in the file. That way we aren't
fooled by wrapper scripts and dummy files.

https://bugzilla.gnome.org/show_bug.cgi?id=791293

buildsystem: use branch in builddir path

If the build system didn't override the build directory, make sure we take
the branch into account for the builddir. This helps avoid stomping over
each other when two workbench windows are open with different branches.

https://bugzilla.gnome.org/show_bug.cgi?id=792383

flatpak: take current branch into account

We need to use the current branch so that we can compartmentalize a build
in case the application is opened with a different branch in another
workbench window.

https://bugzilla.gnome.org/show_bug.cgi?id=792383
beautifier: make ownership transfer explicit
beautifier: use g_clear_pointer()

beautifier: no need to warn on non-existent file

This is a bit chatty, as it will almost always warn on startup
for applications not using it.
build: fix alignment

diagnostics: update diagnostics after successful build

After we complete a successful build, request that diagnostics be re-run
for the open buffers. This helps when changing things in dependent files
and "building" to test.

flatpak: work around flatpak-builder --state-dir bug

It appears that if we don't want updates, flatpak-builder will still query
the remote peer because it fails to find a local mirror directory for the
peer. However, if we specify --extra-sources, we can make it find it as
expected.

We probably need to fix builder_context_find_in_sources_dirs_va() to check
the specified --state-dir.
flatpak: try harder to avoid downloads at startup
flatpak: add docs to state-dir property

flatpak: do not allow downloads from dependencies stage

This needs to be done in the earlier downloads stage. Otherwise,
we might try to download a second time, which is pretty damn
annoying (and not possible w/o network connection anyway).

flatpak: do network query immediately

We can ignore the rest of the work if the network is down and
we won't be able to query the peer anyway. It also ensures we
don't clear the force-update bit.
code-index: code style cleanup

build: temporarily bundle meson

Just until the builds finish. This let's us get a bundle out
quicker though.
symbol-tree: style cleanup
symbol-tree: add more task info
symbol-tree: clear symbol tree when changing documents
clang: code style cleanup
clang: ensure children array is finalized

code-index: be more lazy creating code indexers

Don't create them until necessary. We can also just store an adapter
which won't hold any objects for a given extension as a negative hit
for a given language.

We can also use const/interned strings for the key and direct pointer
comparison.
code-index: code style cleanup

messages: use signal group for signal

This just helps protect against multiple calls to set the context or a
NULL value for the context.
util: special-case widget being an IdeWorkbench

util: ensure IdeWidgetContextHandler is emitted only once per change

It was possible previously that we could notify multiple times for the same
IdeContext. This stashes a pointer (only for comparison) in quark data like
we do with our handler. It then only notifies when that has changed.

Additionally, we move to using the Quark API instead of the string-based
API.
context: fix G-I annotation

persistent-map-builder: plug document leak

We need to release the variants during finalize.
code-index: set G_PARAM_STATIC_STRINGS
release 3.27.4

main: log XDG_CURRENT_DESKTOP to simplify troubleshooting quirks

This detects the XDG_CURRENT_DESKTOP and logs it along with our gtk version
to simplify tracking down issues. Running with -v will display this
information.

main: check for dbus session address on startup

Builder relies on a properly configured desktop session with the DBus
session address propagated in the standard manner.

context: emit ::log per line

This simplifies handlers by ensuring we emit ::log on a per-line basis.

utils: take \r into account for line reading

This also includes a test for the condition.
object: logging can be used from threads now
project-tree: don't override dim-label color
code-index: remove unused variable

project-tree: handle selection chanages gracefully

If we race against some other action changing the selected item, we might
not have a valid selection in the callbacks. So instead, we'll take a
reference to the tree node as GData to the popover (and then read that
back instead of reading the tree selection).
beautifier: make iter use same signedness in comparison
beautifier: fix leak of self in async call
threading: increase number of indexer threads
appdata: fix typo
update release notes

symbol-tree: ignore empty trees

We might get a valid tree pointer back, but it contains no
children nodes. In this case, simply ignore the tree and
instead try the next symbol resolver who might have something
more interesting.
object: fix type check and be more flexible
build-manager: use contextual logging
build-manager: cleanup chained cancellation
gtk: be more flexible with NULL widgets
project-tree: use contextual logging
spellcheck: use contextual logging
todo: use contextual logging
git: use contextual logging
gdb: use contextual logging
gaction: style cleanup
vim: use contextual messaging
langserv: use contextual logging
clang: remove unnecessary \n
build-manager: use contextual logging
buffer: use object helpers for contextual logging

buffer-manager: use ide_object_warning()

This allows providing some information to the user via the
message panel.
object: add logging helpers for IdeObject

util: add helper to log to widgets IdeContext

If we can get an IdeContext for a widget, we can simplify the
logging process for plugins and internal apps.

context: add helper to emit ::log

This will allow us to add some helper wrappers as well.

context: add ide_context_message()

This is similar to ide_context_message() but for non error-like
messages.

context: proxy all log messages to main loop

This reuses the build log to proxy messages to the main loop.
We need this so the messages panel never gets a signal from
something other than the main thread.

diagnostics: warn and bail

I'm not happy that we hit this, but we might as well bail for
now instead of crashing.
editor: set stack manually instead of .ui file
editor: handle initialization gracefully

messages: add a messages panel, hidden by default

This adds a new utilities panel that will show log messages
from Builder and it's plugins. Not much currently proxies
messages to the context yet, but we'll improve that going
forward so that they show up here.

context: add IdeContext::log signal

This can be used to implement a messages API. We may want to
ensure that we proxy log messages via main loop.
utilities: always update button state

code-index: be nicer about error messages

Try harder to set them, and be more lenient when something
doesn't like the clang indexer did.

unsaved-files: protect access to unsaved files array

There is a miss-behaving plugin that is not accessing these correctly
*only* from the main thread. So lets protect against that as the first
step to mitigate the miss-use.

highlight: avoid GData for backpointer

We don't need GData/Quark for this. We can just add a private
function to get the pointer directly.
buffer: add helper to get highlight engine

unsaved-files: remove main thread check

This is safe to call from a thread, as the caller owns the
copy of the unsaved file.

unsaved-files: remove main thread check

This can be called from a thread and that is just fine.
buffer-addin: be assertive about main thread usage

beautifier-plugin: use per project Builder cache dir

The old beautifier cache dir is also removed at load
time to cleanup a previous launch.
xml-pack: prevent for analysing null size files
beautifier plugin: set context
beautifier plugin: port warnings to message API
beautifier plugin: fix a map entries leak
beautifier plugin: create tmp files in a subdir

Revert "beautifier: fix leak of self in async call"

This reverts commit 0d97531c9c437ca777f063edff6811a37e6474f2.
beautifier plugin: more config files changes

beautifier plugin: use g_subprocess_communicate instead of the uft8 version

To better handle the out and err streams and avoid a leak or
double free on validation error, we validate it manually.
beautifier plugin: move self Builder config to gresource
beautifier plugin: do some changes to config files

beautifier plugin: move config files to gresource

We can also now build the plugin as an embedded one
beautifier plugin: fix view cleanup
gjs-symbols: Always return errors on failure
build: Use Meson's built-in llvm dependency

app: Added clone repository action to app-menu

Builder has clone repository option in the greeter, but this is not there in
global application menu.

This patch adds a clone repository option to app-menu making it accessible from
anywhere.

Fixes #193
Update Spanish translation
Update Spanish translation
Update Finnish translation
flatpak-manifest: update libdazzle url
flatpak-manifest: update builder url
Flatpak: bump uncrustify to latest stable
main: spell D-Bus and GTK+ correctly
Update POTFILES.in

beautifier plugin: translatable strings fixes

Fix grammar (“entry disabling”, “dir”), use Unicode apostrophes,
and move comments directly above the strings so they get picked up
by gettext.
Update POTFILES.in

gdbwire: fix format string error when compiling with clang

https://bugzilla.gnome.org/show_bug.cgi?id=791923

issue_comments.body:
Thank you for contributing to gnome-builder!

gnome-builder uses Bugzilla for code review.

If you have never contributed to GNOME before make sure you have read the
getting started documentation:
http://www.gnome.org/get-involved

Otherwise please visit
https://wiki.gnome.org/Newcomers/CodeContributionWorkflow
and follow the instructions there to upload your change to Bugzilla.

commit_comments.body: L'etichetta è contestualizzata, imho basterebbe "Carattere a spaziatura fissa".
